summary: Table CSV file is used for importing and exporting table metadata from and to an **existing** table.

headers.name: name
headers.description: The name of the table being updated.

headers.name: description
headers.description: Description for the table in Markdown format.
examples: `Customer Schema` that contains all the tables related to customer entity.

headers.name: owner
headers.description: Owner names separated by ';'. For team owner, include prefix team. For user owner, include prefix user.

headers.name: tags
headers.description: Fully qualified classification tag names associated with the table separated by ';'.. These tags are automatically applied along with the glossary term, when it is used to label an entity.

headers.name: retentionPeriod
headers.description: Retention period of the data in the table. Period is expressed as duration in ISO 8601 format in UTC. Example - `P23DT23H`. When not set, the retention period is inherited from the parent database schema, if it exists.

headers.name: domain
headers.description: Domain to which the table belongs to.

headers.name: column.fullyQualifiedName
headers.description: Fully qualified name of the column.

headers.name: column.description
headers.description: Description for the column in Markdown format.
examples: `user_id` column is the primary key and contains unique user ID.

headers.name: column.dataTypeDisplay
headers.description: Display name used for dataType. This is useful for complex types, such as `array<int>`, `map<int,string>`, `struct<>`, and union types.

headers.name: column.tags
headers.description: Fully qualified classification tag names associated with the column separated by ';'.. These tags are automatically applied along with the glossary term, when it is used to label an entity.
